channel.title: Carrollton News RSS Feed
channel.description: This is the syndication feed for City of Carrollton, TX. Carrollton News

item.title: Carrollton Reports First Positive Mosquito Trap of the Season
item.description:
Click to view PDF 
Dallas County Health and Human Services (DCHHS) has confirmed the first mosquito sample testing positive for West Nile Virus (WNV) of the year in Carrollton. The sample was collected...

item.title: Severe Weather Cleanup Updates
item.description: June 24 3:00 p.m. The City has determined that the storm on May 28 was the worst storm Carrollton has had in terms of widespread vegetative debris in 40 years. In a new video, Carrollton’s Emergency Management Coordinator Elliott Reep answers some...

item.title: Carrollton Ranks Among the Top Safest Cities Nationwide
item.description: The City of Carrollton ranks among the top 25 safest cities nationwide on GOBankingRates’ “50 Safest and Most Affordable US Cities To Live In” report. According to GOBankingRates’ May review of the largest U.S. cities by population, Carrollton has...

item.title: Volunteer for Carrollton’s CARE Team
item.description: Carrollton stands as the first city in Texas to adopt the groundbreaking 4 Minute City™ Program. This initiative aims to equip CPR-trained citizen volunteers with AEDs, thereby reducing the time required to provide lifesaving care to patients...

item.title: Carrollton Seeks Citizen Input for Downtown Expansion
item.description: The City of Carrollton is expanding its Downtown Master Plan to develop the area near the Dallas Area Rapid Transit (DART) Green Line Light Rail. Don’t miss the opportunity to make a difference. The objective of the expansion is to build on the...

item.title: Carrollton to Provide Special Collection of Storm Debris
item.description: The City of Carrollton has contracted with current provider Republic Services and CrowderGulf Disaster Recovery & Debris Management to conduct a special collection of storm debris at residential addresses, beginning Monday, June 3....

item.title: Carrollton to Host Eighth Annual Paws on the Square Event
item.description: Bring the whole family, both furry and otherwise, to Historic Downtown Carrollton (1106 S. Broadway Street) on Saturday, June 8, from 9 a.m. to noon, for a tail-wagging good time at the City’s eighth annual Paws on the Square. This free,...

item.title: Festival at the Switchyard Vendor Applications Now Open
item.description: The City of Carrollton has opened applications for craft and food vendors to participate in the 14th annual Festival at the Switchyard on Saturday, November 2 from 11 a.m. to 10 p.m. in Historic Downtown Carrollton (1106 S. Broadway Street). The...

item.title: Trinity River Authority Sanitary Sewer Outflow Notice Due to Heavy Rain
item.description: The Trinity River Authority has notified the City of Carrollton that its Central Regional Wastewater System treatment plant experienced a wastewater outflow in its collection system on Tuesday, May 28, that exceeded 100,000 gallons. It occurred in an...

item.title: Take Carrollton's Parks & Recreation Master Plan Survey
Help Turn the Page Through Carrollton Public Library's Survey
item.description: In an effort to continue providing high level services to both existing and future patrons, the Carrollton Public Library has opened a survey opportunity to the community. The survey is anonymous and open to everyone through Monday, July 1. The...

item.title: Carrollton to Hold Memorial Day Ceremony
item.description: The City of Carrollton will hold a wreath-laying ceremony on Monday, May 27 at 10 a.m. to honor fallen U.S. military personnel who have given their lives in service to the nation. All are welcome to join Carrollton Mayor Steve Babick and City...

item.title: Carrollton Receives 2024 Municipal Traffic Safety Award
item.description: The City of Carrollton Municipal Court received a 2024 Municipal Traffic Safety Awards Honorable Mention in April from the Texas Municipal Courts Education Center (TMCEC). The award is given to a municipal court in recognition for outstanding...

item.title: Free Summer Breakfast and Lunch Program Begins May 28
item.description: School’s out for the summer, and that means hundreds of local children will be looking for places they can meet their friends, have fun, and eat healthy meals. The free Summer Food Program is ready to meet the demand. Carrollton’s Parks and...

item.title: Carrollton Swears In City Councilmembers, Certifies Charter Revs
item.description: The results of the General Election and Special Charter Election on May 4 were canvassed and certified during the Tuesday, May 14 meeting at City Hall. All four of the Carrollton City Council seats from the May 2024 General Election ballot were...

item.title: Carrollton Celebrates Independence Day with Fireworks July 3
item.description: The City of Carrollton will celebrate the rockets’ red glare with the annual Independence Day Fireworks Show over Josey Ranch Lake on Wednesday, July 3 after sunset. Enjoy a spectacular display of star-spangled fireworks at 9:30 p.m. over Josey...

item.title: Cleanup Carrollton? Challenge Accepted
item.description: Be a part of the pollution solution by volunteering to remove trash and debris from the environment to help Carrollton’s streets, waterways, and green spaces thrive.  The City is taking part in the Spring 2024 North Texas Community Cleanup...

item.title: City of Carrollton Retains Multiple ‘AAA’ Ratings on Bonds
item.description: Fitch Ratings, Inc. and S&P Global Ratings independently assigned a “AAA” rating to the City of Carrollton’s general obligation (GO) improvement and refunding bonds, waterworks and sewer system revenue bonds, and the outstanding bonds in each...

item.title: Unofficial Results of Carrollton General & Special Election Are In
item.description: The unofficial election results for the May 4 General and Special Charter Election are in. Results remain unofficial until City Council canvasses the votes at the Tue., May 14 Council Meeting. For more information on the 2024 election results,...

item.title: Vote in the General Election Saturday May 4
item.description: The City of Carrollton will hold a General Election and Special Charter Election on Sat., May 4 to elect Council places 1, 3, 5, and 7 and to consider proposed changes to the City Charter. To vote in the May 4 election, you must have registered to...

item.title: Book Reading Goals with the 2024 Summer Reading Challenge
item.description: The Carrollton Public Library presents the 2024 Summer Reading Challenge (SRC) running from Saturday, June 1 through Thursday, August 1 and includes age-specific reading programs for everyone. Register now at...

item.title: Carrollton Chosen for National Sustainability Leadership Program
item.description: The City of Carrollton has been selected by the U.S. Green Building Council (USGBC), the leading authority on green building and global developer of the Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED) green building program, as one of 12 cities...

item.title: Register Day of for Carrollton Tails & Trails 5K Race or 1-Mile Walk
item.description: Preregistration is over, but participants can still register on race day. Park at Creekview High School (3201 Old Denton Road) to register and be bused to the starting line on the Blue Trail. Race day registration and warmup will be held from 7-7:45...

item.title: Carrollton Residents Will Soon See Woodlake Lake Improvements
item.description: Woodlake Lake (near the corner of N. Josey Lane and E. Peters Colony Road) will undergo site renovations thanks to Carrollton residents who voted in the 2018 Bond Election for Parks & Recreation Improvements. The approved $22.4 million-Parks...

item.title: Carrollton City Council Approves Community Funding Policy
item.description: City Council approved a resolution on Tuesday, April 16 updating the Community Funding Policy, combining the existing Community Services Policy and Community Events Policy into a single document and application.  The purpose of the policy is to...

item.title: Don't Miss Carrollton Women's First Responder Day April 20
item.description:
Discover the Bond of Courage and Service
Calling all service-minded young women: Explore what it means to be part of a close-knit family of first responders dedicated to safeguarding the City of Carrollton. This recruitment-based event,...

item.title: DART Construction at the Downtown Carrollton Station on N. Broadway
item.description: Dallas Area Rapid Transit (DART) is in Phase II of the reconstruction of the rail crossings and adjacent roadway along N. Broadway Street and N. Denton Drive with a southbound, left-lane closure of N. Broadway Street 24/7 from Tuesday, April 16...

item.title: Deadline Approaches for Protesting Appraisal District Property Values
item.description: Collin, Dallas, and Denton County Appraisal Districts have issued notices to Carrollton residents informing homeowners of the value of their property as of Sunday, January 1. This notice, either mailed or posted to the respective County’s website,...

item.title: Carrollton's Destination 2040 Vision Campaign Survey
item.description: The City of Carrollton is excited to announce the second of two, upcoming opportunities for residents and businesses to provide feedback and contribute to the future of the City. All community members interested in taking part are invited to Hebron...

item.title: Carrollton Publishes Annual Financial Report Fit for the Masses
item.description: The City of Carrollton recently published the 2023 Popular Annual Financial Report, or PAFR, for the community to review a high-level, easy-to-read compilation of the City’s budgetary and financial status. The 2023 PAFR covers the fiscal year October...

item.title: Carrollton Recognizes Volunteer Award Winners
item.description: The City of Carrollton honored community volunteers for their hard work and dedication at the 16th Annual Citizens’ Evening event held Wednesday, March 27. Twenty-two nominations were received in four different categories for the ninth annual...

item.title: Carrollton’s Newest Leisure Connections Magazine is Available
item.description: Carrollton’s Leisure Connections recreation magazine is now available at Rosemeade Recreation Center, Crosby Recreation Center, Josey Ranch Lake Library, Hebron & Josey Library, the Carrollton Senior Center, City Hall,...

item.title: Find Out the hoopla at the Carrollton Public Library
item.description: The Carrollton Public Library recently launched hoopla, a new media service offering a collection of audiobooks, eBooks, comics, music, movies, TV, and more for free with a Carrollton Public Library card. Subscribers can stream content online at...
